intro: Barleria hypocrateriformis, commonly known as the red barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright red, tubular flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. The flowers attract bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological value.
